cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: moving between the north coast of Hispaniola and the Turks and Caicos Islands
cyclone.trajectory: tracking WNW across the southeastern and central Bahamas, then turning northwest toward the Florida peninsula

weather_observation.watch_coast: Jupiter Inlet southward around the Florida peninsula to Bonita Beach, including the Florida Keys, Lake Okeechobee and Florida Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: None for Florida as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida east coast, Florida Keys, and portions of Georgia/South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: High confidence of tropical-storm-force winds with a 26-27% chance of hurricane-force (64 kt) winds as Irma moves northward along Florida’s east coast; peak onset probability 49% for 34-kt winds in 72–96 h.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft surge possible along the barrier islands and inlets near Port Canaveral if Irma tracks just offshore.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible with locally higher amounts, producing flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; possible minor coastal erosion impacting port approaches.
